Thurs., April 18: Everyone deserves a second chance, and all of us are safer when people have that chance to succeed.

Dear ##SM_RULE_360 Email Salutation##,

Join the ACLU of Connecticut Smart Justice campaign, State Representative Robyn Porter, and more for a community conversation about stopping discrimination against people on the basis of their criminal record.

In March of 2019, HB 6921, a bill to prevent discrimination against people on the basis of their criminal record, passed out of committee. As the first state to introduce this kind of legislation, Connecticut has a chance to show millions of justice-impacted people nationwide that there is hope for a better future.

Join us on Thursday, April 18 at 6 p.m. at the Beulah Heights First Pentecostal Church in New Haven for a community conversation on ending discrimination for people impacted by the justice system.
